column5: I have fished Wabaskang Lake and Beaver Lake but have not fished Wine Lake much. I have not been any further south than the entrance to Beaver. How is the fishing south?
Wine Lake is a grand walleye fishery. Have fished the outlet, Dynamite bay, and areas around Wine Lake Camp and they all hold lots of fish. Average size is larger than Wabaskang.

I have fished the bay at the outlet on the north side and did ok. We have caught some big walleye in Beaver Lake. I don't know where Dynamite bay is. We have been staying at Peffley's for the last 25 years and like the trip to Beaver and a shore lunch. We used to portage over the falls to Lake Sharon but I am getting to old for that trip. We will use that day for fishing Wine Lake instead. Thanks for the tip.
Hopefully the invasion of the red boats dont turn Wine Lake into Wabaskang. Oops, did I say that out loud? Red boats impede the fishing on wine lake and the fish only bite lines from silver boats.
